result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery D Uptain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  AODA and follow through treatment as recommended.  Absolute sobriety.  No use/possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  Random UA's per agent.  Seek/maintain full-time employment.  Any other conditions per agent.  116 days credit if probation would be revoked.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery D Uptain

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery D Uptain in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Jeffery D Uptain.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Duren states the matter is resolved and the State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Duren and DE are in agreement.  Court questions DE on plea agreement.  DE pleads NC.  Court accepts plea/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Duren makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court admonishes DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  DE will remain in custody as Juneau Co and Rock Co both have warrants for him.

Ct 1:  NC
3 years probation
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment
Absolute sobriety
No use/possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid prescription
Random UA's per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment
Any other conditions per agent
116 days credit if probation would be revoked
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery D Uptain in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Jeffery D Uptain.  Atty Duren received and waives reading of Information.  DE advised of charge and penalty.  Atty Duren stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea.  Matter is resolved.  Atty Duren to get a plea and sentencing date from Br. 2 JA.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 09:47 AM Defendant Jeffery D Uptain in court, in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer Gjefle appears.  DE wishes to dismiss case, was wearing seatbelt.  Court denies motion to dismiss.  DE wishes to obtain counsel.  Court is going to proceed.  State calls Josiah Gjefle, LDPD, S&T.  DE cross exam.  State objects, relevance already answered.  State rests.  Court directs of DE to testify.  DE wishes to testify.  DE sworn in and testifies. State cross exam.   Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  Set arraignment in Br. 2.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:48 PM Defendant Jeffery D Uptain in court, in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffery D Uptain appeared by video means.  Atty Kathryn Hayes also appears but she states that the DE wishes to represent himself for his bail hearing today.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney, waived for today's hearing.  State requests $1,000 cash bond w/conditions.  DE responds noting he's on probation holds and warrants in other counties.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  $250.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety and no possession of controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
